Will such a catastrophe be due to biotechnology or bioengineered organisms?
All results are analysed here, and will be updated periodically.

P.title: Longbets series: By 2040 will the percentage of college-aged U.S. citizens who are attending postsecondary educational institutions in the United States drop at least 50% from the level in 2011?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
If the Long Now Foundation declares Brant von Goble the winner then this question resolves positively. If they declare John C Leven the winner, this question resolves negatively

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on the percentage of college-aged U.S. citizens attending postsecondary educational institutions in the U.S. dropping at least 50% from the 2011 level by 2040, will the annual rate of US labor productivity growth for 2025 be 2 percent or above?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By 2040, the percentage of college-aged U.S. citizens attending postsecondary educational institutions in the United States drops at least 50% from the level in 2011. Then, will the annual rate of US labor productivity growth for the year 2025, as measured by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, be 2 percent or above?

Resolution Criteria for the condition:
If the Long Now Foundation declares Brant von Goble the winner, then this condition resolves positively. If they declare John C Leven the winner, this condition resolves negatively.

Resolution Criteria for the outcome:
If Robert D Atkinson is declared the winner of the bet by the Long Now Foundation, then this question resolves positively. If Alberto Forchielli is declared the winner, then this question resolves negatively.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Conditional on the percentage of college-aged U.S. citizens attending postsecondary educational institutions in the U.S. dropping at least 50% from 2011 levels by 2040 AND the annual rate of US labor productivity growth for 2025 being 2 percent or above, will the US Supreme Court change its membership size before 2050?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for P:
1. If the Long Now Foundation declares Brant von Goble the winner, then the first part of this question resolves positively. If they declare John C Leven the winner, the first part resolves negatively.
2. If Robert D Atkinson is declared the winner of the bet by the Long Now Foundation, then the second part of this question resolves positively. If Alberto Forchielli is declared the winner, the second part resolves negatively.

Both parts must resolve positively for this question to resolve positively.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
This question will resolve as Yes if the US Supreme Court officially changes its regular number of sitting justices above or below 9 members at any point between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2050.
Expected vacancies and arrivals of justices (retirements, deaths, and absences for health reasons) are not sufficient to resolve the question.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: By 2040, will the percentage of college-aged U.S. citizens attending postsecondary educational institutions in the U.S. drop at least 50% from 2011 levels, will the annual rate of US labor productivity growth for 2025 be 2 percent or above, AND will the US Supreme Court change its membership size before 2050?
P_and_Q_and_R.body:
Resolution Criteria
1. If the Long Now Foundation declares Brant von Goble the winner, then the first part of this question resolves positively. If they declare John C Leven the winner, the first part resolves negatively.
2. If Robert D Atkinson is declared the winner of the bet by the Long Now Foundation, then the second part of this question resolves positively. If Alberto Forchielli is declared the winner, the second part resolves negatively.
3. This question will resolve as Yes if the US Supreme Court officially changes its regular number of sitting justices above or below 9 members at any point between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2050. Expected vacancies and arrivals of justices (retirements, deaths, and absences for health reasons) are not sufficient to resolve the question.

All three parts must resolve positively for this question to resolve positively.

P.title: Will AI progress surprise us by predictions of AGI jumping sharply?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
What is the likelihood of discontinuous progress around the development of Human Level Machine Intelligence (i.e. machines that can accomplish a wide range of important tasks at least as good as human experts)?
This question resolves as YES if both the Metaculus prediction odds and the community prediction odds of a positive resolution to Human Machine Intelligence Parity by 2040 at least triple within any two-month period before its close date, and NO otherwise.
Some examples of a tripling of the odds are 60% becoming at least 81.8%, 70% becoming at least 87.5%, 80% becoming at least 92.3%, 90% becoming at least 96.4%, etc.
Fine Print
Edited 8/29/18 to require the change in both Metaculus and community prediction as the source of odds.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on AI progress surprising us by predictions of AGI jumping sharply, will the Eurozone collapse before 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for P:
What is the likelihood of discontinuous progress around the development of Human Level Machine Intelligence (i.e. machines that can accomplish a wide range of important tasks at least as good as human experts)?
This question resolves as YES if both the Metaculus prediction odds and the community prediction odds of a positive resolution to Human Machine Intelligence Parity by 2040 at least triple within any two-month period before its close date, and NO otherwise.
Some examples of a tripling of the odds are 60% becoming at least 81.8%, 70% becoming at least 87.5%, 80% becoming at least 92.3%, 90% becoming at least 96.4%, etc.
Fine Print
Edited 8/29/18 to require the change in both Metaculus and community prediction as the source of odds.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
This question will resolve as "yes" if, at any time between December 1, 2020 to January 1, 2030, the European Central Bank (ECB) formally closes, or the Euro is no longer the de facto primary currency for all three of Germany, France, and Italy. For the purposes of this question, being a "de facto primary currency" means that at least 50% of all transactions are conducted using that currency.
Fine Print
Edit: on April 17, 2022, clarified that "no longer the de facto primary currency" means for all three of Germany, France, and Italy, not just any one of those three.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Conditional on both AI progress surprising us by predictions of AGI jumping sharply and the Eurozone collapsing before 2030, will any senior executives of major public companies be imprisoned for corporate crimes before 2026?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for P:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur:
(a) The Metaculus prediction odds and the community prediction odds of a positive resolution to Human Machine Intelligence Parity by 2040 at least triple within any two-month period before its close date. Some examples of a tripling of the odds are 60% becoming at least 81.8%, 70% becoming at least 87.5%, 80% becoming at least 92.3%, 90% becoming at least 96.4%, etc. (Edited 8/29/18 to require the change in both Metaculus and community prediction as the source of odds).
(b) At any time between December 1, 2020 to January 1, 2030, the European Central Bank (ECB) formally closes, or the Euro is no longer the de facto primary currency for all three of Germany, France, and Italy. For the purposes of this question, being a "de facto primary currency" means that at least 50% of all transactions are conducted using that currency. (Edit: on April 17, 2022, clarified that "no longer the de facto primary currency" means for all three of Germany, France, and Italy, not just any one of those three).
The question resolves as NO if either or both of the above conditions are not met.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
This question will resolve as Yes if any senior executive (current or former) is convicted of crimes relating to actions taken in a corporate capacity (ie ignoring crimes committed which are unrelated to their companies and crimes committed for their own benefit at the expense of their employer (eg insider trading)), and their prison sentence begins between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2026.
Senior executives are those executives and directors who are named on official filings to their respective stock exchanges.
An executive will be eligible in this question if they are employed by a company that was listed in any of these major indices at any time in 2021 or later, even if subsequently delisted:
S&P500
FTSE100
DAX40
CAC40
FTSE MIB
Nikkei 22

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will both AI progress surprise us by predictions of AGI jumping sharply and the Eurozone collapse before 2030, and any senior executives of these major public companies be imprisoned for corporate crimes before 2026?
P_and_Q_and_R.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves as YES if all of the following occur:
(a) The Metaculus prediction odds and the community prediction odds of a positive resolution to Human Machine Intelligence Parity by 2040 at least triple within any two-month period before its close date. Some examples of a tripling of the odds are 60% becoming at least 81.8%, 70% becoming at least 87.5%, 80% becoming at least 92.3%, 90% becoming at least 96.4%, etc. (Edited 8/29/18 to require the change in both Metaculus and community prediction as the source of odds).
(b) At any time between December 1, 2020 to January 1, 2030, the European Central Bank (ECB) formally closes, or the Euro is no longer the de facto primary currency for all three of Germany, France, and Italy. For the purposes of this question, being a "de facto primary currency" means that at least 50% of all transactions are conducted using that currency. (Edit: on April 17, 2022, clarified that "no longer the de facto primary currency" means for all three of Germany, France, and Italy, not just any one of those three).
(c) Any senior executive (current or former) is convicted of crimes relating to actions taken in a corporate capacity (ie ignoring crimes committed which are unrelated to their companies and crimes committed for their own benefit at the expense of their employer (eg insider trading)), and their prison sentence begins between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2026. Senior executives are those executives and directors who are named on official filings to their respective stock exchanges. An executive will be eligible in this question if they are employed by a company that was listed in any of these major indices at any time in 2021 or later, even if subsequently delisted: S&P500, FTSE100, DAX40, CAC40, FTSE MIB, Nikkei 22.
The question resolves as NO if any of the above conditions are not met.

P.title: Will the People's Republic of China control at least half of Taiwan before 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any of the following occur between January 1, 2020 and January 1, 2050:
There are at least five reliable articles listing areas controlled by the People's Republic of China, includes areas of the current territory ("free area" as of October 2020) of the Republic of China (including the islands of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen and Matsu) which amount to at least half the population of the current territory of the ROC, according to the latest reliable population demographic data.
There are at least five non-opinion articles from different reliable sources asserting that the PRC controls at least half or most of Taiwan.
There are at least five articles (including opinion articles) from different reliable sources asserting that the ROC is a puppet state of the PRC and citing evidence that the government of the majority of the ROC is de facto controlled by China, and the ROC (rather than a third state) controls at least half of the current territory of the ROC. Articles which, in the judgment of Metaculus, are hyperbole or otherwise do not make a strong case that the ROC is a puppet state of the PRC will not count.
Fine Print
A peaceful reunification of China and Taiwan would result in this question resolving Yes.
Articles must be written and published by different sources and must reach their conclusions largely independently, publishing the same article at a separate news outlet or several news outlets reporting statements made by the same individual or group of individuals will not count as separate articles.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on the People's Republic of China controlling at least half of Taiwan before 2050, will there be a "World War Three" before 2050?
Q_given_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for P:
This question will resolve as Yes if any of the following occur between January 1, 2020 and January 1, 2050:
There are at least five reliable articles listing areas controlled by the People's Republic of China, includes areas of the current territory ("free area" as of October 2020) of the Republic of China (including the islands of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen and Matsu) which amount to at least half the population of the current territory of the ROC, according to the latest reliable population demographic data.
There are at least five non-opinion articles from different reliable sources asserting that the PRC controls at least half or most of Taiwan.
There are at least five articles (including opinion articles) from different reliable sources asserting that the ROC is a puppet state of the PRC and citing evidence that the government of the majority of the ROC is de facto controlled by China, and the ROC (rather than a third state) controls at least half of the current territory of the ROC. Articles which, in the judgment of Metaculus, are hyperbole or otherwise do not make a strong case that the ROC is a puppet state of the PRC will not count.
Fine Print
A peaceful reunification of China and Taiwan would result in this question resolving Yes.
Articles must be written and published by different sources and must reach their conclusions largely independently, publishing the same article at a separate news outlet or several news outlets reporting statements made by the same individual or group of individuals will not count as separate articles.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true:
There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
At least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
[see edit history in the fine print]
Fine Print
PPP will may be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence:
IMF
World Bank
United Nations
CIA
[2022-03-24]: Edited to clarify that "world GDP" will be determined in PPP for condition 1 .
[2021-11-24]: Edited to clarify the time constraints.
(Edit 1/16/19 to remove third "described as WWIII" criterion.)

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Conditional on both the People's Republic of China controlling at least half of Taiwan and a "World War Three" occurring before 2050, will lepton universality be falsified before 2026?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur before 2050: (a) the People's Republic of China controls at least half of Taiwan and (b) there is a "World War Three". Then is the following true: A peer-reviewed paper is published before 2025/12/31 claiming to have found evidence at the 5σ level or greater that lepton universality is violated in nature?

Resolution Criteria for P:
(a) The People's Republic of China controls at least half of Taiwan between January 1, 2020 and January 1, 2050. This will be determined if any of the following occur:
- There are at least five reliable articles listing areas controlled by the People's Republic of China, including areas of the current territory ("free area" as of October 2020) of the Republic of China (including the islands of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen, and Matsu) which amount to at least half the population of the current territory of the ROC, according to the latest reliable population demographic data.
- There are at least five non-opinion articles from different reliable sources asserting that the PRC controls at least half or most of Taiwan.
- There are at least five articles (including opinion articles) from different reliable sources asserting that the ROC is a puppet state of the PRC and citing evidence that the government of the majority of the ROC is de facto controlled by China, and the ROC (rather than a third state) controls at least half of the current territory of the ROC. Articles which, in the judgment of Metaculus, are hyperbole or otherwise do not make a strong case that the ROC is a puppet state of the PRC will not count.
- A peaceful reunification of China and Taiwan would result in this question resolving Yes.
- Articles must be written and published by different sources and must reach their conclusions largely independently, publishing the same article at a separate news outlet or several news outlets reporting statements made by the same individual or group of individuals will not count as separate articles.
(b) There is a "World War Three" between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050. This will be determined if both of the following conditions are true:
- There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
- At least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
A peer-reviewed paper is published before 2025/12/31 claiming to have found evidence at the 5σ level or greater that lepton universality is violated in nature.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the People's Republic of China controls at least half of Taiwan before 2050, (b) there is a "World War Three" before 2050, and (c) lepton universality is falsified before 2026?
P_and_Q_and_R.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following occur:
(a) The People's Republic of China controls at least half of Taiwan between January 1, 2020 and January 1, 2050. This will be determined if any of the following occur:
- There are at least five reliable articles listing areas controlled by the People's Republic of China, including areas of the current territory ("free area" as of October 2020) of the Republic of China (including the islands of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen, and Matsu) which amount to at least half the population of the current territory of the ROC, according to the latest reliable population demographic data.
- There are at least five non-opinion articles from different reliable sources asserting that the PRC controls at least half or most of Taiwan.
- There are at least five articles (including opinion articles) from different reliable sources asserting that the ROC is a puppet state of the PRC and citing evidence that the government of the majority of the ROC is de facto controlled by China, and the ROC (rather than a third state) controls at least half of the current territory of the ROC. Articles which, in the judgment of Metaculus, are hyperbole or otherwise do not make a strong case that the ROC is a puppet state of the PRC will not count.
- A peaceful reunification of China and Taiwan would result in this question resolving Yes.
- Articles must be written and published by different sources and must reach their conclusions largely independently, publishing the same article at a separate news outlet or several news outlets reporting statements made by the same individual or group of individuals will not count as separate articles.
(b) There is a "World War Three" between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050. This will be determined if both of the following conditions are true:
- There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
- At least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
Fine Print
PPP will be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence:
- IMF
- World Bank
- United Nations
- CIA
[2022-03-24]: Edited to clarify that "world GDP" will be determined in PPP for condition 1.
[2021-11-24]: Edited to clarify the time constraints.
(Edit 1/16/19 to remove third "described as WWIII" criterion.)
(c) A peer-reviewed paper is published before 2025/12/31 claiming to have found evidence at the 5σ level or greater that lepton universality is violated in nature.
